meanings.definition: Shocked or offended by something considered improper or immoral.
meanings.sent1: The scandalised look on her face showed how shocked she was by the news.
meanings.sent2: She felt scandalised when she heard about the scandal at the company.
meanings.sent3: The scandalised reaction from the cat when it saw a cucumber behind it was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The scandalised gasps from the audience echoed through the theater.
meanings.sent5: The scandalised expression on his face was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel shocked or offended by something considered improper or immoral.
meanings.sent1: The news article scandalised many readers with its shocking content.
meanings.sent2: Her behavior scandalised the entire community.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel scandalised the birds by stealing their food.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist in the movie scandalised the audience.
meanings.sent5: The magician scandalised the crowd with his unbelievable tricks.
